content.description: Start on a slopey rail to the right of the big incut rail/fin. Move up the bulge on small, sharp holds without using the fin. Finish just left of the tallest part of the wall.
content.protection: Pad(s) and a good spotter. Be careful, as the fall zone is downward sloping.
content.location: About 10 feet to the right of the cave on the left side of Hueco Overhang Ridge, start on the sloping rail to the right of the obvious input rail/flake.

content.description: Start on the arete on the right side of the boulder, traverse left until you get to some jugs, and then head straight up on cool jugs to the topout.
content.protection: It's nice to have a few pads, since the landing is rocky and uneven, but it's not super high.

content.description:
On the far left side of Hueco Overhang Ridge near a small cave, start on a couple of bowling ball holds on the left side of the cave, and move up and right to a hand jam between two fins. Then, reach for the top!

It is sharp and a bit crumbly.
content.protection: Pads. There are a few boulders in the fall zone, so try to cover these boulders, and give a good spot.
content.location: This is on the far left side of Hueco Overhang Ridge.

content.description: Begin at two heavily-chalked small huecos/pockets. Move up and slightly right into (eventually) a higher group of huecos before topping out. Use fun balance and deadpoints on this one!
content.location: It is around the middle of the Hueco Overhang Wall starting at two small, obvious pockets.
